title.narrative: GENDER AND ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: ESAR has regional evidence and tools to guide gender responsive and adolescent programming, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ESAR Country Offices achieve Programming Excellence (programmes are gender and equity focused, respond to humanitarian and development contexts, deliver and demonstrate results) by 2021

participating-org.narrative: CENTRE FOR RURAL HEALTH UNIVERSITY OF KWAZULU NATAL
MINISTRY OF ECONOMIC PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT
MINISTRY OF EDUCATION ARTS AND CULTURE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: ESAR has regional evidence and tools to guide gender responsive and adolescent programming

description.narrative: ESARO provided technical support to ESAR COs on gender-transformative programming;and young;people participation and engagement in particular to Ethiopia, Eritrea, South Sudan, Somalia, Uganda, Kenya, Burundi, Malawi, Zimbabwe, Zambia, South Africa, Madagascar and Namibia, including during Gender Programmatic Review, CPD or mid-term reviews. ESARO;provided targeted support to L3/L2 emergencies in the region and piloted new Gender Core Commitments for Children in Humanitarian Action in Mozambique and Madagascar. ESARO initiated 2 research on gender transformative programming on health programming and on ending harmful practices such as Child Marriage. ESARO also positioned Gender in the broader Climate Change agenda. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/03/2022

title.narrative: Number of research products and tools produced on gender equitable and adolescent programming(51829)
